title: RDP Port 3389 Exposed
description: Remote Desktop Protocol is open to the internet, exposing the system to brute force attacks.

title: Outdated Apache Version
description: Apache 2.4.29 is running, which contains multiple critical CVEs (e.g., CVE-2021-41773).

title: Public S3 Bucket
description: An Amazon S3 bucket containing sensitive configuration files is publicly accessible.

title: Unpatched Windows 10
description: Windows 10 machines are missing the latest security patches from the last 3 months.

title: Weak Admin Passwords
description: Administrator accounts have weak passwords detected through credential stuffing attempts.

title: Open MongoDB Instance
description: A MongoDB database is running without authentication and is accessible from the internet.

title: Phishing Email Detected
description: Multiple users received a phishing email impersonating IT support to steal credentials.

title: Exposed Jenkins Dashboard
description: The Jenkins CI/CD dashboard is accessible without authentication.

title: Outdated WordPress Plugins
description: Several WordPress plugins in use have known vulnerabilities and have not been updated.

title: Lack of MFA on Admin Accounts
description: High-privilege admin accounts do not enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
